page.title: 29Buildings of Interest
page.content:
Seal: "Kentish Yeoman". This is part of an early Tudor building. It was a court house, with a lime pit in the garden to dispose of corpses after hanging. Tunnel link to Church.

Kemsing: "The Keep" and "Castlebank" These are 16th. century built as halls on the site of 12th.C. Kemsing Castle (demolished 14th. century)

"Box House" facing the well, inhabited for over 1,000 years. St. Edith wasn born in this former convent. Present house dates from 1686.

"Ivy Farm House" a former mediaeval double hall, the oldest inhabited building in Kemsing.

Kemsing Youth Hostel - a former 19th.C. Ragstone Vicarage was sold in 2006 and is now 7 dwellings.

Noah's Ark: Noah's Ark Cottage is the oldest building in the area. Name given because of its ability tosurvive floods!

Contribution by: Kemsing Heritage Centre Association
